name: The Honorable H. William DEWEESE, Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Individually and on Behalf of the Democratic Caucus of the House of Representatives, Appellants v. The Honorable Mark S. SCHWEIKER, Governor of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and the Honorable C. Michael Weaver, Secretary of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Appellees. Honorable Robert C. Jubierler, President Pro Tempore of the Senate and Matthew J. Ryan, Speaker of the House, Intervenors

parties: The Honorable H. William DEWEESE, Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Individually and on Behalf of the Democratic Caucus of the House of Representatives, Appellants v. The Honorable Mark S. SCHWEIKER, Governor of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and the Honorable C. Michael Weaver, Secretary of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Appellees. Honorable Robert C. Jubierler, President Pro Tempore of the Senate and Matthew J. Ryan, Speaker of the House, Intervenors.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 19th day of February, 2003, the above captioned appeal is quashed for failure to file post verdict motions.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
816 A.2d 1099
The Honorable H. William DEWEESE, Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Individually and on Behalf of the Democratic Caucus of the House of Representatives, Appellants v. The Honorable Mark S. SCHWEIKER, Governor of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and the Honorable C. Michael Weaver, Secretary of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Appellees. Honorable Robert C. Jubierler, President Pro Tempore of the Senate and Matthew J. Ryan, Speaker of the House, Intervenors.
No. 169 MAP 2002.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Feb. 19, 2003.
